definition: to pave (with paving stones)/to lay a road/(fig.) to lay the groundwork (for sth)/to give a present to sb to ensure success
plank bed/place to sleep/shop/store/(old) relay station
to spread/to display/to set up/(old) holder for door-knocker

sentences.chinese: 我們還侵佔它們的棲息地，鋪路蓋房子。

sentences.english: They are never active to do anything; they are just passive to pave road and build bridge for their members.
sentences.chinese: 他們從不主動做任何事，只是被動地爲成員鋪路架橋。

sentences.english: The pavers on the lawn are environmentally friendly and easy to maintain.
sentences.chinese: 在草坪上鋪路既環保，又易於維護。

sentences.english: Will the Private Cloud be a stepping stone towards the vision of Enterprise Cloud Computing?
sentences.chinese: 私有云是否會成爲通往企業雲計算的鋪路石呢？

sentences.english: Consider pavers with gaps that can be planted.
sentences.chinese: 考慮可以種植的差距鋪路。

sentences.english: The paviours beetled the paving stones and loose earth.
sentences.chinese: 鋪路工夯實鋪路石和鬆土。

sentences.english: The paviours beetled the paving stones and loose earth.
sentences.chinese: 鋪路工夯實鋪路石和鬆土。

sentences.english: As a matter of fact, a successful person is capable of setting goals and paving the way against all odds.
sentences.chinese: 就事論事，成功者懂得立定目標，又能排除萬難鋪路。

sentences.english: The paving stones burned in the noon sun.
sentences.chinese: 鋪路石被中午的太陽曬得滾燙。

sentences.english: But bottle glass can be ground into sand and used to pave streets.
sentences.chinese: 但是瓶玻璃可磨成沙，用於鋪路的街道。

sentences.english: Carry stones up into the houses; line the windowsills and the roofs with them.
sentences.chinese: 把鋪路石搬進樓房，沿着窗臺和閣樓的窗戶排齊。

sentences.english: A flat slab of stone used as a paving material.
sentences.chinese: 板石用作鋪路材料的扁平的石塊。

sentences.english: Covariates Zheng Hong cen, not to regret, but paves the way for progress.
sentences.chinese: 鄭宏岑，反是不思去後悔，而是爲前進鋪路。

sentences.english: Paveway ii laser-guided bombs started to explode .
sentences.chinese: 鋪路式激光制導炸彈開始爆炸了。

sentences.english: The pavers absorb the park's rainwater runoff from the grassy areas.
sentences.chinese: 鋪路材料可以吸收公園裏草地流出來的雨水。

sentences.english: And he flung on the ground, deprived of its pavement, the four uniforms.
sentences.chinese: 他把這些制服扔在挖去了鋪路石的地上。

definition: to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
to fight for/to strive for/to win over
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
(Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
to pull strings/to manipulate (a puppet)/to control from behind the scene/to mediate
to take it up a notch/to bring it up a level
